name: Adversarial Learning
description: This Knowledge Unit (KU) focuses on the principles and techniques of adversarial learning, including generating adversarial examples, defenses against adversarial attacks, and the implications for AI security and robustness.
outcomes: Identify key concepts and terminologies in adversarial learning.
Recall different types of adversarial attacks and defenses.
Explain the significance of adversarial learning in AI security.
Describe the process of generating adversarial examples.
Implement techniques to create adversarial examples.
Apply defenses to protect AI models from adversarial attacks.
Analyze the effectiveness of different adversarial attacks on AI models.
Compare various defense mechanisms against adversarial attacks.
Assess the robustness of AI models against adversarial examples.
Evaluate the trade-offs between model performance and security.
Develop strategies to improve the robustness of AI models.
Design experiments to test AI models against adversarial attacks.
topics: Definition and Importance of Adversarial Learning
Types of Adversarial Attacks (e.g., Evasion, Poisoning, and Extraction)
Techniques for Generating Adversarial Examples (e.g., FGSM, PGD)
Benchmarking AI Models Against Adversarial Attacks
Impact on AI Security and Privacy
Analysis of Adversarial Attacks in Different Domains
Integrating Robustness into the AI Development Lifecycle
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Emphasize practical applications and hands-on activities., Include real-world examples and case studies to illustrate key concepts., Highlight the continuous improvement and adaptation of defenses against adversarial attacks.
